meanings.definition: To keep watch over or guard vigilantly.
meanings.sent1: The security guard watchdogged the building all night.
meanings.sent2: She watchdogged her little brother at the park to keep him safe.
meanings.sent3: The cat watchdogged the fishbowl, making sure no one got too close.
meanings.sent4: The owl watchdogged the forest, its eyes sharp in the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The loyal dog watchdogged the house, barking at any unfamiliar sound.

meanings.definition: Vigilant and alert in monitoring or safeguarding something.
meanings.sent1: The watchdogged squirrel quickly scampered up the tree when it sensed danger.
meanings.sent2: The watchdogged security system alerted the homeowners of any intruders.
meanings.sent3: The watchdogged student always double-checked his work to avoid mistakes.
meanings.sent4: The watchdogged lifeguard scanned the pool area for any signs of trouble.
meanings.sent5: The watchdogged parent never let their child out of sight in crowded places.

meanings.definition: A person or group that monitors and oversees a particular activity or situation.
meanings.sent1: The neighborhood watchdogged kept an eye on any suspicious activities in the area.
meanings.sent2: The financial watchdogged ensured that all transactions were conducted ethically.
meanings.sent3: The technology watchdogged was always the first to identify new trends in the industry.
meanings.sent4: The media watchdogged played a crucial role in exposing corruption scandals.
meanings.sent5: The environmental watchdogged fought tirelessly to protect endangered species from harm.
